Ademption.definition: the revocation of a gift in a will inferred from the disposal
Ademption.origin: [Latin ademptio , from adimere to take away, from ad to + emere to buy, obtain]

1.definition: the revocation of a gift in a will inferred from the disposal (as by sale) of the property by the maker of the will before he or she dies

2.definition: the revocation of a gift in a will inferred from the maker's gift before his or her death of the same or similar property to the recipient named in the will compare
2.note: Only gifts that are characterized as specific devises, bequests, or legacies are subject to ademption.
